newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA M1 RISES 35 PCT, M2 UP 29 PCT IN DECEMBER.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA M1 RISES 35 PCT, M2 UP 29 PCT IN DECEMBER.

text.p: Bulgarian M1 money supply rose to
239.5 billion levs on December 27 from 222.8 billion levs on
November 29 and M2 increased to 1,239.4 billion levs from 1,165
billion levs, preliminary central bank figures showed.
M1 year-on-year increase for December was 122 percent while
M2 gained 117 percent from December 1995.
Total broad money rose 29 percent between November 29 and
December 27 to 1,305.6 billion levs as lev-denominated broad
money increased 21 percent to 654.4 billion levs and
dollar-denominated broad money gained 38 percent to 651.2
billion levs.
Hard currency-denominated deposits of companies totalled
$712.4 million on December 27, down from $725.8 million a month
earlier and $879.7 million at end-December 1995.
Foreign currency-denominated deposits of individuals stood
at $497.4 million at end-December, up $15 million from the
month before but down $745.8 million year-on-year, figures
showed.
Lev-denominated deposits of individuals totalled 81.8
billion levs on December 27 against 51.1 billion levs a month
earlier and 57.8 billion levs at the end of 1995.
Bulgaria's annual inflation was 310.8 percent year-on-year
in December while the lev traded near 500 per dollar at
year-end, down from around 70 at the end of 1995.
-- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
